p.s: Description of Kitasatosporia mediocidica sp. nov.

Kitasatosporia mediocidica (med'i.o.cid.i.ca. L. n. mediocidin, antibiotic produced by the type strain of this species; L. adj. suff. -icus, possessing a character of; mediocidica, possessing mediocidin)

Kitasatosporia mediocidica substrate mycelium ranges from moderate yellow to shades of light brown, depending upon the growth medium; very sparse white to gray aerial hyphae bearing smooth-surfaced spores in short open coils (Retinaculum-Apertum) are produced on several media (e.g., inorganic salts-starch agar, glycerol-asparagine agar, or yeast extract-malt extract agar).
Yellow to brown soluble pigments are produced on many growth media.
Adenine, hippurate, hypoxanthine, starch, and Tween 80 are hydrolyzed; allantoin, casein, cellulose, esculin, gelatin, guanine, tyrosine, urea, and xanthine are not hydrolyzed.
Phosphatase but not nitrate reductase activity produced.
Growth occurs in the presence of 1.5% NaCl but not in the presence of 3.0% NaCl.
Assimilation of DL-malate but not acetate, benzoate, citrate, lactate, mucate, oxalate, propionate, succinate, or L-tartrate.

Acid produced from L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, dextrin, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, glycerol, lactose, maltose, sucrose, and D-xylose; variable production of acid from D-mannitol and trehalose ; no acid produced from adonitol, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, myo-inositol, D-melezitose, D-melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, β-methyl-xyloside, D-raffinose, rhamnose, salicin, or sorbitol.
Guanine-plus-cytosine content of DNA, 74 mol% (thermal denaturation midpoint method).
The type strain of K. mediocidica is strain NRRL B-16109.
